[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "the Industrial Revolution began in reality before the accession of George III" (redundant "in reality").
Cumbersome structure in "the anchor was again on its way to the surface when a row-boat driven by four oarsmen with drawn muscles and clenched teeth glided in under the bow of the ship."
[STRUCTURE]: Sudden shift from historical analysis to nautical voyage without clear transitional phrases.
[LEXICON]: Ambiguous reference to "our last passenger" without clear antecedent.
[PUNCTUATION]: Comma splice in "We passed on and as their fountains of spray disappeared in the distance the sun sank down..."

[LOGIC]: Disjointed transition from historical analysis of revolutions to Philippine education mission without clear causal link.
[STRUCTURE]: Sudden insertion of Bahá’í Faith/Toynbee reference in middle of voyage narrative creates jarring conceptual shift.
Disconnected segments on Hawaiian landmarks and Bahá’í history within single voyage narrative.
[TRANSITION]: Abrupt jump from museum description to surf-shooting to date line crossing without narrative cohesion.
[CLARITY]: Unclear connection between Industrial Revolution/French monarchy and Philippine education mission.
